title: Oasis Live ’25 World Tour
articleDescription: Friday 31 October, Saturday 1 November and Tuesday 4 November at Marvel Stadium
articleContent:
Following the announcement that was felt around the world, the global cultural phenomenon continues with Oasis’ return.

The Australian leg, produced by Live Nation, will see Oasis play at Marvel stadium on Friday 31 October, Saturday 1 November and Tuesday 4 November, with special guests Ball Park Music.

Before you travel

If you use Journey Planner within 14 days of this event, you'll see all the extra services we've added to help you get there.

Friday 31 October

Event commences at 5pm.

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Frankston, Sandringham, Werribee, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury

Werribee line passengers are advised to alight on Newport services from Southern Cross (Platform 14), then transfer at Newport for a connecting bus.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a via La Trobe Street, and as Route 86a via Bourke Street.

Take advantage of the city’s Free Tram Zone which extends from Queen Victoria Market to Docklands, Spring Street, Flinders Street Station and Federation Square. 

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the show.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds line

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Wendouree, Ballarat & Bendigo lines

Return coaches due to rail replacement services depart from Southern Cross Station after the concert:

  • Seymour Line

Saturday 1 November 

Event commences at 5pm.

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Glen Waverley, Sandringham, Sunbury and Craigieburn

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Frankston, Sandringham Werribee, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury
     

Werribee line passengers are advised to alight on Newport services from Southern Cross (Platform 14), then transfer at Newport for a connecting bus.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a via La Trobe Street, and as Route 86a via Bourke Street.

Take advantage of the city’s Free Tram Zone which extends from Queen Victoria Market to Docklands, Spring Street, Flinders Street Station and Federation Square. 

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the show.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds and Wendouree lines

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Wendouree, Bendigo, Ballarat and Bendigo lines

Return coaches due to rail replacement services depart from Southern Cross Station after the concert:

  • Seymour Line

Tuesday 4 November

Event commences at 5pm.

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Glen Waverley, Sandringham, Sunbury and Craigieburn

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Greenborough, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Cheltenham, Frankston, Flinders Street, Werribee, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury
     

Werribee line passengers are advised to alight on Newport services from Southern Cross (Platform 14), then transfer at Newport for a connecting bus.

Sandringham line passengers are advised to board Frankston services from Southern Cross (Platform 13) and change at South Yarra for a bus.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a via La Trobe Street, and as Route 86a via Bourke Street.

Take advantage of the city’s Free Tram Zone which extends from Queen Victoria Market to Docklands, Spring Street, Flinders Street Station and Federation Square. 

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the show.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds and Wendouree lines

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Geelong, Wendouree, Ballarat & Bendigo lines

Return coaches due to rail replacement services depart from Southern Cross Station after the concert:

  • Traralgon Line

Additional information

  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google Wallet™ app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.
